hostNotes.text: Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on dealing with stressful situations. We’ll be doing a short introduction, listen to a meditation exercise, followed by reflection and then finally sharing.
hostNotes.asyncText: Welcome! This session is about dealing with stressful situations. (I am x…) There will be a meditation exercise, a moment to reflect, and the final step is to share what we experienced.

hostNotes.text:
Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.
hostNotes.asyncText:
Before we move on into the session, check-in with yourself for a few seconds. What brought you here today?

…

Let’s get started.

hostNotes.text: When we're stressed, our perceived expectations often exceed our resources. This can lead to a feeling of being overwhelmed, with thoughts and feelings spinning round and round in our heads and bodies.
hostNotes.asyncText: When we're stressed, our perceived expectations often exceed our resources. This can lead to a feeling of being overwhelmed, with thoughts and feelings spinning round and round in our heads and bodies.

hostNotes.text:
In this meditation, we'll practice taking a break from the spinning wheel and gaining some distance from our thoughts. This can help us gain perspective, relax, and change our priorities.

> Press play to start the meditation.
hostNotes.asyncText:
In this meditation, we'll practice taking a break from the spinning wheel and gaining some distance from our thoughts. This can help us gain perspective, relax, and change our priorities.

> Press play to start the meditation.

hostNotes.text:
Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own.

What did you notice as you changed focus to the short to do-list?
hostNotes.asyncText:
Take 1 minute to reflect. 

What did you notice as you changed focus to the short to do-list?

hostNotes.text:
You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.
hostNotes.asyncText:
Take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. There are no right or wrong answers, so whatever comes up is okay.

> Press play to start the timer.

hostNotes.text:
Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for  2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.
Well done. if you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.
hostNotes.asyncText: Well done! If you're up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life. In times of stress, recovery is essential.

hostNotes.text: In stressful periods recovery is key. Let’s give ourselves some care and gain perspective by taking a step back and take a breathing break at least once a day for the coming week.
hostNotes.asyncText: Let's give ourselves some care and gain perspective by taking a step back and taking a breathing break at least once a day for the coming week.

hostNotes.text:
Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. 

What will you bring for the rest of your day from this? Please answer in two-three words.
hostNotes.asyncText:
Before leaving this space, check-out with yourself. 

What will you bring from this session for the rest of today?

hostNotes.text:
Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.
hostNotes.asyncText: When you’re ready, finish the session to go to the exit experience.

en.name: Drop all requirements

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

en.description: Guided meditation for a mindful break during busy days. Re-focusing and grounding ourselves can help reduce stress, reprioritize and give our minds a refreshing break.

hostNotes.text: Bem-vindos. Eu sou o/a X e hoje vamos estar juntos durante 30 minutos a refletir sobre como lidar com situações stressantes.  Faremos uma breve introdução, um exercício de meditação e teremos depois um momento de reflexão e partilha conjunta.
hostNotes.asyncText: Bem-vinda/o! Nesta sessão vamos refletir sobre como lidar com situações stressantes. Faremos um exercício de meditação e teremos depois um momento de reflexão e partilha da experiência.

hostNotes.text:
Vamos começar com um mini check-in. Como te sentes agora? Por favor, responde com duas ou três palavras. X, gostarias de começar?

> Permite que todos na sessão, inclusivé tu, façam check-in individual

Obrigada/o a todos pelo check-in. Vamos começar.
hostNotes.asyncText:
Antes de iniciarmos a sessão, faz uns segundos de check-in contigo própria/o. O que te trouxe aqui hoje?

…

Vamos começar.

pt.name: Deixa cair todas as exigências

hostNotes.text: > Começa a sessão quando estiveres pronta/o.

pt.description: Uma meditação guiada para uma pausa consciente nos dias mais atarefados. Re-focar a nossa atenção e ancorarmo-nos no presente pode ajudar-nos a reduzir o stress, compreender as prioridades e refrescar a mente.

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

<Main question> <Further explanations of main question if needed>

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. <X minutes> starting now.

> Push play to start the timer.

That’s <X minutes> and it’s time to move on.

Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for <x minutes> as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Well done. if you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.
